name: 200 Corona Grande by Joya de Nicaragua
additionalNotes:
Privada CC monthly selection for April '23.

"About 6 years ago, Joya De Nicaragua produced this cigar for a friend of ours, someone you all know whose name I am not allowed to disclose due to contractual obligations. The cigars sat in a warehouse in Naples, FL for about 3 years and then shipped to us. We have been sitting on these since we moved into our new warehouse 3 years ago. I have to be honest, I did not like this cigar originally. I had been told about the amazing processes and tobaccos used in it, but again, I held them for another 2.5 years because I was not initially wowed. That is, until recently, when one Saturday morning I was perusing the warehouse to find something to smoke, I stumbled across the coolers. I noticed an aroma that was very peated, reminding me of Ardbeg Scotch when I opened them. Iâ€™m rarely wrong about how cigars will age, but I was wrong about this one! This cigar is a testament to professional aging and how much it can allow a cigar to develop when done correctly."

https://privadacigarclub.com/product/the-200-aged-6-years/
